name: Your First Stamp
address: Anywhere in the world
about:
Welcome to Stampbook!
This is your first special stamp that you can claim from anywhere.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Tap "Collect Stamp"
Go out there and explore the world!

name: Baker Beach
address:
1504 Pershing Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94129
about: A public beach with stunning Golden Gate Bridge views.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Bring a picnic blanket and relax with the Golden Gate
Hike Batteries to Bluffs Trail along the cliffs

name: Dolores Park
address:
Dolores St & 19th St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94114
about: Local favorite park with wide open grassy areas perfect for people watching.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Grab Crème Brûlée ice cream from Bi-Rite
Visit the southwest corner at sunset

name: Pier 39
address:
Beach St & The Embarcadero
San Francisco, CA, USA 94133
about: Popular waterfront marketplace famous for resident sea lions, shops, and stunning bay views.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Go to the end and smell the sea lions
Walk to Fisherman’s Wharf and Ghirardelli Chocolate

name: Ferry Building
address:
1 Ferry Building
San Francisco, CA, USA 94111
about: Historic terminal and marketplace with artisan food vendors and iconic clock tower.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Find porchetta sandwich during the Saturday farmers’ market (8am-2pm)
Taste Vietnamese Coffee ice cream from Humphry Slocombe

name: Oracle Park
address:
24 Willie Mays Plaza
San Francisco, CA, USA 94107
about: Home of the San Francisco Giants and one of baseball's most beautiful ballparks.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order garlic fries and crab sandwich - two ballpark food legends
Walk along the San Francisco Bay Trail to see under the Bay Bridge.

name: Twin Peaks
address:
501 Twin Peaks Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94114
about: One of the highest points in the city with 360-degree panoramic views.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Arrive 30 minutes before sunset
Bring layers - it gets windy and cold

name: Japantown
address:
1610 Geary Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94115
about: One of the oldest Japanese communities in the US with authentic restaurants and shops.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Browse Japanese snacks, drinks, and bento at Nijiya Market
Eat amazing udon, yakitori, takoyaki, matcha ice cream, and mochi donuts

name: Powell-Hyde Cable Car
address:
Powell St & Market St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94102
about: One of San Francisco's most scenic cable car routes with stunning bay views.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Board at Powell & Market early morning to avoid 2-hour waits
Stand on the outer running board going down Hyde Street for thrilling bay views

name: Palace of Fine Arts
address:
3601 Lyon St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94123
about: Stunning Greco-Roman monument with a rotunda and lagoon built for the 1915 Exposition.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Visit at golden hour for stunning light on the rotunda reflected in the lagoon
Walk around the entire lagoon to find different angles of the columns

name: Painted Ladies
address:
710-720 Steiner St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94117
about: Iconic row of Victorian houses at Alamo Square, famous from Full House.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Bring a picnic blanket and snacks to enjoy the view from the park
Take photos from the Alamo Square lawn in late afternoon when the houses glow golden

name: Golden Gate Viewpoint
address:
Old Conzelman Rd
Mill Valley, CA, USA 94941
about: Breathtaking elevated views of the Golden Gate Bridge from the Marin Headlands.
thingsToDoFromEditors: You need a car to drive up here
You can see the Golden Gate with San Francisco from the other side.

name: Equator Coffee
address:
Golden Gate Bridge Plaza
San Francisco, CA, USA 94129
about: This is in the Round House Café, which has an amazing view of the Golden Gate Bridge.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order the single-origin pour-over to taste their roasting expertise
Walk to Baker Beach to collect another stamp

name: The Coffee Movement
address:
1399 9th Ave
San Francisco, CA, USA 94122
about: Inner Sunset neighborhood favorite serving carefully sourced coffee.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order their coffee flight to taste a variety
Try their seasonal specialty coffee (I once had Orange Cream Latte).

name: Andytown Coffee Roasters
address:
3655 Lawton St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94122
about: Coffee roasters near Ocean Beach famous for the Snowy Plover affogato.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order the Snowy Plover (brown sugar ice cream + espresso) - their signature drink
Take your drink to Ocean Beach and relax by the water

name: Neighbor Bakehouse
address:
2343 3rd St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94107
about: Dogpatch bakehouse combining excellent coffee with fresh-baked pastries.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Arrive early for warm croissants - they sell out by noon
Walk to the Dogpatch waterfront along 3rd Street after your coffee

name: The Mill
address:
736 Divisadero St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94117
about: Famous for Four Barrel coffee and house-made artisan toast.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order the cinnamon sugar toast - their iconic signature item
Walk to Alamo Square and the Painted Ladies 10 minutes away

name: Saint Frank Coffee
address:
2340 Polk St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94109
about: Bright, minimalist Russian Hill café serving meticulously sourced coffee.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Ask baristas about their rotating single-origin espresso - they love sharing details
Try the cortado to experience their roasting at its purest

name: Sightglass Coffee
address:
270 7th St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94103
about: Spacious SoMa warehouse café where they roast their own beans on-site.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Watch them roast coffee through the glass-walled roasting room
Try the espresso tonic on warm days - refreshing and caffeinated

name: Four Barrel Coffee
address:
375 Valencia St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94103
about: Beloved Mission District roaster known for quality and direct trade.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order classic drip coffee to taste their legendary roasting
Explore Clarion Alley's murals one block away at Valencia & 17th

name: Pinhole Coffee
address:
231 Fillmore St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94117
about: Cozy, intimate Lower Haight café for specialty coffee.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Sip their perfectly crafted flat white at the window bar
Browse vintage shops on Haight Street a few blocks east

name: Ballast Coffee
address:
798 Florida St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94110
about: Mission café serving thoughtfully sourced coffee in a minimalist space.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Grab coffee here then walk to Tartine Bakery for morning buns
Bring your laptop - the wifi is solid and the vibe is calm

name: Japanese Tea Garden
address:
75 Hagiwara Tea Garden Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94118
about: The oldest public Japanese garden in the US with pagodas, koi ponds, and tea house.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Arrive right at opening (9am) for serene photos before crowds
Stop at the tea house for traditional tea and fortune cookies

name: Three Gems by James Turrell
address:
50 Hagiwara Tea Garden Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94118
about: Hidden James Turrell skyspace installation inside the de Young Museum.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Free admission before 10am on Saturdays - perfect for experiencing Three Gems
Lie on the benches and watch the sky change through the skyspace opening

name: Portals of the Past
address:
John F. Kennedy Dr & 6th Ave
San Francisco, CA, USA 94118
about: Marble columns from a Nob Hill mansion destroyed in the 1906 earthquake.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Photograph the columns reflected in Lloyd Lake at sunrise
Walk around the lake to see the columns from different perspectives

name: Conservatory of Flowers
address:
100 John F. Kennedy Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94118
about: Victorian greenhouse and oldest building in Golden Gate Park with rare tropical plants.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Visit the Aquatic Plants room to see giant water lilies and carnivorous plants
Come during holiday season for spectacular light displays on the building

name: Bison Paddock
address:
John F. Kennedy Dr & Chain of Lakes Dr
San Francisco, CA, USA 94121
about: Home to a herd of American bison since 1891 in Golden Gate Park.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Visit early morning (7-9am) when bison are most active and near the fence
Bring binoculars if they're grazing in the back of the paddock

name: Fort Mason Community Garden
address:
2 Marina Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94123
about: Terraced community garden at Fort Mason with stunning waterfront views.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Walk through the terraced gardens then continue to Fort Mason waterfront
Visit in spring/summer to see the gardens at their most lush

name: Bernal Heights Community Garden
address:
Folsom St & Ellsworth St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94110
about: Vibrant neighborhood garden with organic plots and fruit trees.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Check the bulletin board for free gardening workshops and events
Hike up Bernal Hill right after for 360-degree city views

name: Garden for the Environment
address:
7th Ave & Lawton St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94122
about: Educational garden teaching sustainable practices with workshops and native plants.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Sign up for a free weekend workshop on composting or native plants
Explore the native plant section for California gardening ideas

name: Clipper Terrace Community Garden
address:
Clipper St & Douglass St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94114
about: Hillside terraced garden with panoramic city views and colorful flowers.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Walk the terraced paths for unique city views between the garden plots
Visit in peak summer for the most colorful flower displays

name: Potrero Hill Community Garden
address:
Utah St & 20th St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94107
about: One of San Francisco's oldest community gardens, established in the 1970s.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Explore the garden then grab lunch at nearby Chez Maman on 18th
Visit during monthly open houses to meet gardeners and learn tips

name: Alemany Farm
address:
700 Alemany Blvd
San Francisco, CA, USA 94110
about: San Francisco's largest urban farm spanning 3.5 acres with stunning views.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Join Saturday volunteer mornings (10am) to help with planting and harvesting
Take in the sweeping city views from this hilltop farm

name: Howard Langton Community Garden
address:
Howard St & Langton St
San Francisco, CA, USA 94103
about: Hidden SoMa garden known for creative vertical space and container gardening.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Study their vertical gardening techniques for small-space inspiration
Peek through the fence even when closed to see creative container gardens

name: Bubble Rock
address:
Bubble Rock Trail
Bar Harbor, ME, USA 04609
about: Massive 50-ton glacial boulder perched on South Bubble Mountain.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Take the classic 'pushing the rock' optical illusion photo
Continue to South Bubble summit for panoramic Jordan Pond views

name: Beehive Trail Summit
address:
Beehive Trail
Bar Harbor, ME, USA 04609
about: Thrilling hike featuring iron rungs and ladders on exposed cliff faces.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Arrive before 7am to avoid waiting at the iron rungs sections
Wear gloves for better grip on the metal rungs and ladders

name: Beal's Lobster Pier
address:
182 Clark Point Rd
Southwest Harbor, ME, USA 04679
about: Classic Maine seafood shack serving fresh lobster rolls with harbor views since 1985.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order the warm buttered lobster roll over cold mayo version
Bring cash - they don't take cards but have an ATM nearby

name: McKay's Public House
address:
231 Main St
Bar Harbor, ME, USA 04609
about: Beloved Irish-style pub known for cozy atmosphere and craft beers.
thingsToDoFromEditors: Order fish & chips with a local Maine beer like Allagash or Shipyard
Check their schedule for live music nights on weekends
